title: High Female Participation in Business Ownership
description: In 2017, 70.4% of firms in Ecuador had female participation in ownership, showcasing a strong presence of women in the business sector.

title: Extensive Formal Training in Firms
description: As of 2017, 73.7% of firms in Ecuador offered formal training to their employees, indicating a commitment to workforce development.

title: Limited Unemployment Benefits for the Poorest
description: In 2022, only 0.46% of the poorest quintile in Ecuador received unemployment benefits, highlighting a gap in social safety nets.

title: Low Female Child Employment Rates
description: In 2015, only 0.14% of female children aged 7-14 were self-employed, reflecting low child labor rates among girls.

title: Higher Male Child Employment Rates
description: In 2015, 0.31% of male children aged 7-14 were self-employed, indicating a higher prevalence of child labor among boys compared to girls.

title: Moderate Overall Child Employment Rates
description: In 2015, 0.24% of children aged 7-14 were self-employed, suggesting moderate levels of child labor in Ecuador.
